page.title: 04NEW USE FOR FORMER QUARRY.
page.content: This quarry is now a testing ground for dumpers and excavators made by Aveling and Barford in Grantham.No staff is employed at the quarry and it is used only intermittently.It provides no jobs for local people.Some of the machines which are tested here are special orders to be dispatched to distant parts of the world. Once this quarry provided sand and gravel from a morainic pocket left behind in the last Ice Age.The uneven surfaces and varying levels which provide such a good testing ground for heavy machines are also exploited once or twice a year by a local motor-cycle club for scrambling races. A minor Roman road ran along the east edge and some Roman remains have been found here.
